Within a maximum duration of 02 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions specified in Clauses 1, 2, 3 of this Article, the Financial Policy Department shall send the application and such opinions to the SBV Banking Supervision Agency for its opinions; with regard to the special loans specified in Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 of this Circular, the list of collateral types specified in Point d Clause 1 of this Article shall be send to Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam for their opinions. If the credit institution’s list of collateral types includes financial instruments, the Financial Policy Department shall send the list to SBV’s Operations Center for its opinions.

5. Within a maximum duration of 07 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article, the SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the following contents:

a) The operating status and solvency of the credit institution (if the applicant is subject to the microprudential supervision of the SBV Banking Supervision Agency);

b) Whether or not the credit institution has restructuring policies submitted by SBV to the Government or Prime Minister or has approved restructuring policies; contents about settlement of the special loan granted to the credit institution included in such restructuring policies (if any);

c) Whether or not the credit institution has an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan (unless the credit institution’s restructuring plan is subject to the approval of SBV’s provincial branch);  

d) Based on the credit institution’s list of collateral types as specified at Point d Clause 1 of this Article, opinions about the satisfaction of eligibility requirements laid down in Article 13 of this Circular by the listed collateral types (unless the applicant is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV’s provincial branch);

dd) Whether or not the extension of special loan should be granted to the credit institution that is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV’s provincial branch. If the extension of special loan should be granted, specific extended amount, extension period and interest rate must be specified. If the extension of special loan should not be granted, reasons thereof must be given;

e) Opinions about the proposal of SBV’s provincial branch specified in Point dd Clause 3 of this Article in case the credit institution is subject to the microprudential supervision of the SBV’s provincial branch.

6. Within a maximum duration of 07 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from SBV (the Financial Policy Department) as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam and Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall give their written opinions to SBV (the Financial Policy Department) about the credit institution’s list of collateral types for extended special loan.

7. Within a maximum duration of 07 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article, SBV’s Operations Center shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the collateral types which are financial instruments included in the credit institution’s list of collateral types.

8. If written opinions given by requested agencies are not adequate as prescribed in this Article, within a maximum duration of 03 working days from the receipt of such written opinions, the Financial Policy Department shall send written request to relevant agencies for additional opinions. Within a maximum duration of 07 working days from the receipt of the written request from the Financial Policy Department, requested agencies must provide their additional opinions as requested.

9. Within a maximum duration of 07 working days from the receipt of adequate opinions from relevant agencies as prescribed in Clauses 5, 6, 7, 8 of this Article, the Financial Policy Department shall prepare and submit a consolidated report thereof to the SBV’s Governor for grant of extension of special loan to the credit institution. If an application for special loan extension is refused, SBV shall provide written reasons for its refusal to the credit institution.

10. In case a credit institution wishes to apply for extension of special loan specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4, or Point a Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular in case its approved restructuring plan or transfer plan includes contents about the extension of special loan, the extension of special loan shall conform to the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan; procedures for special loan extension shall be followed according to Article 19 of this Circular.

Article 19. SBV’s grant of special loan extension according to Prime Minister’s decision, approved recovery plan, mandatory transfer plan or transfer plan

1. With regard to the special loans specified in Points b, c, d and dd Clause 1 Article 4 of this Circular, the credit institution shall, based on the contents about extension of special loan included in the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan, prepare and submit 04 sets of application for extension of special loan to the special control board.

An application for extension of special loan includes:

a) An application form for special loan extension, which specifies amount, interest rate, extension period, and debt repayment according to the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan; contents about the collateral for the special loan included in the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved recovery plan, mandatory transfer plan or transfer plan (if any); commitments to comply with regulations of law on special lending;

b) List of collateral types bearing certification of the special control board (if the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved recovery plan, mandatory transfer plan or transfer plan includes contents about the collateral for special loan). Such list of collateral types must be conformable with the contents about the collateral included in the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved recovery plan, mandatory transfer plan or transfer plan;

c) Other relevant documents (if any).

2. Within a maximum duration of 02 working days from the receipt of an adequate application as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the special control board shall send 01 set of application to SBV’s provincial branch (if the applicant’s restructuring plan is subject to the approval of SBV’s provincial branch), and 02 other sets of application to SBV (the Financial Policy Department), accompanied by its written opinions about the extended amount, interest rate, extension period, and debt repayment.

3. Within a maximum duration of 03 working days from the receipt of the application and written opinions specified in Clauses 1, 2 of this Article, SBV's provincial branch shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the following contents:

a) Contents about the extension of special loan granted to the credit institution included in the approved restructuring plan;

b) Based on the list of collateral types specified in Point b Clause 1 of this Article, opinions about the conformity of the list of collateral types with contents about the collateral for special loan included in the approved restructuring plan (if the approved restructuring plan includes contents about the collateral for special loan);

c) Whether or not the extension of special loan should be granted to the credit institution. If the extension of special loan should be granted, specific extended amount, interest rate, extension period and debt repayment must be specified. If the extension of special loan should not be granted, reasons thereof must be given.

4. Within a maximum duration of 02 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions as specified in Clauses 1, 2, 3 of this Article, the Financial Policy Department shall send the application and such written opinions to the SBV Banking Supervision Agency for its opinions. If the credit institution’s list of collateral types includes financial instruments, the Financial Policy Department shall send the written request and the list of collateral types to SBV’s Operations Center for its opinions.

5. Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article, the SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the following contents:

a) Contents about the extension of special loan granted to the credit institution included in the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan (unless the credit institution’s restructuring plan including such contents is subject to the approval of SBV’s provincial branch);  

b) Based on the list of collateral types specified in Point b Clause 1 of this Article, opinions about the conformity of the list of collateral types with contents about the collateral for special loan included in the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved recovery plan, mandatory transfer plan or transfer plan (unless the credit institution’s restructuring plan including such contents is subject to the approval of SBV’s provincial branch);

c) Whether or not the extension of special loan should be granted to the credit institution that is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV’s provincial branch. If the extension of special loan should be granted, specific extended amount, interest rate, extension period and debt repayment must be specified. If the extension of special loan should not be granted, reasons thereof must be given;

d) Opinions about the proposal of SBV’s provincial branch specified in Point c Clause 3 of this Article in case the credit institution is subject to the microprudential supervision of the SBV’s provincial branch.

6. Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article, SBV’s Operations Center shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the collateral types which are financial instruments included in the credit institution’s list of collateral types.

7. If written opinions given by requested agencies are not adequate as prescribed in this Article, within a maximum duration of 03 working days from the receipt of such written opinions, the Financial Policy Department shall send written request to relevant agencies for additional opinions. Within a maximum duration of 07 working days from the receipt of the written request from the Financial Policy Department, requested agencies must provide their additional opinions as requested.

8. Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of adequate opinions from relevant agencies as prescribed in Clauses 5, 6, 7 of this Article, the Financial Policy Department shall prepare and submit a consolidated report thereof to the SBV’s Governor for grant of special loan extension to the credit institution. If an application for special loan extension is refused, SBV shall provide written reasons for its refusal to the credit institution.

Article 20. Grant of special loan or extension of special loan for supporting for liquidity by Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam and other credit institutions

1. When the credit institution placed under special control wishes to apply for special loan as prescribed in Point a Clause 2, Point a Clause 3 and Point a Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular, it shall prepare and send 04 sets of application to Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution.

An application for special loan includes:

a) Documents specified in Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution;

b) The special control board’s document requesting Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution to consider granting special loan to the credit institution placed under special control, which indicates the following contents: The operating status or solvency of the credit institution; specific opinions about the fact the credit institution is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system.

2. Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application specified in Clause 1 of this Article, if the application is approved, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution shall send the special control board’s document to SBV’s provincial branch (if the credit institution is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV’s provincial branch) and SBV Banking Supervision Agency for their opinions about the following contents:

a) Whether or not the credit institution is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and whether or not such insolvency threatens the stability of the system;

b) Contents concerning the special loan granted by Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution specified in the approved restructuring plan (if any).

3. Where necessary, SBV Banking Supervision Agency may get opinions from SBV’s provincial branch before giving its opinions to Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution.

4. Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution shall consider issuing a decision on grant of special loan to the credit institution placed under special control.

5. In case of extension of the special loan specified in Point a Clause 2, Point a Clause 3, Point a Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular:

a) The borrower shall send an application to the lender. Such application includes: the documents requested by the lender; the special control board’s document requesting the lender to consider granting extension of special loan to the borrower (which indicates the operating status and solvency of the borrower);

b) The lender shall consider issuing a decision on grant of special loan extension to the borrower.

Article 21. Grant of special loans or extension of special loans by Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam and other credit institutions according to approved recovery plans or mandatory transfer plans  

Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam and other credit institutions shall consider granting special loans or extension of special loans specified in Point c Clause 2, Point c Clause 3 or Point b Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular according the approved recovery plans or mandatory transfer plans and their internal regulations.

Article 22. Conclusion of special loan agreements, acceptance of pledged or mortgaged collateral, and disbursement of special loans

1. Conclusion of special loan agreement and acceptance of pledged or mortgaged collateral for the special loan specified in Clause 1 Article 4 of this Circular:

a) Within a maximum duration of 03 working days from the receipt of SBV’s document on grant of special loan to the credit institution, Director of SBV’s provincial branch shall, based on this document and relevant laws, conclude the special loan agreement which includes contents about the collateral (if any);

b) If the collateral for the special loan includes financial instruments, within 01 working day from the conclusion of the special loan agreement, SBV’s provincial branch shall send the signed special loan agreement to SBV’s Operations Center;

c) Within 02 working days from the receipt of the signed special loan agreement from SBV’s provincial branch, SBV’s Operations Center shall carry out accounting, pledge and blockade of the collateral which is the financial instruments included in the list of collateral types enclosed with the signed special loan agreement and give a written notification of such actions to SBV’s provincial branch.

2. Conclusion of special loan agreement and acceptance of pledged or mortgaged collateral for the special loan specified in Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 of this Circular:

a) Within a maximum duration of 03 working days from the receipt of SBV’s document on grant of special loan to the credit institution, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall, based on this document and relevant laws, conclude the special loan agreement;

b) After concluding the special loan agreement, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall receive the pledged or mortgaged collateral according to the list of collateral types enclosed with the signed special loan agreement.

3. Conclusion of special loan agreement and acceptance of pledged or mortgaged collateral for the special loan specified in Point c Clause 2, Point c Clause 3, Point b Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular:

Based on the approved recovery plan or mandatory transfer plan, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution shall conclude the special loan agreement and receive the pledged or mortgaged collateral (if any).

4. Disbursement of the special loans prescribed in Clause 1, Points b, c Clause 2, Points b, c Clause 3, Point b Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular:  

a) When the borrower wishes to receive the disbursement of special loan, it shall send a request for disbursement of special loan (hereinafter referred to as “disbursement request”), which indicates the amount, time and reasons for disbursement, to the special control board;

b) Based on the borrower’s demand for use of special loan, the special control board shall consider giving opinions about the borrower’s disbursement request. If the borrower’s disbursement request is approved, the special control board shall send its written opinions about the amount and time of disbursement and the disbursement request specified in Point a of this Clause to SBV’s provincial branch or Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution;

c) SBV’s provincial branch or Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution shall disburse the special loan according to the signed special loan agreement, the borrower’s disbursement request and the special control board’s opinions specified in Points a, b of this Clause;

d) The lender shall only disburse the special loan after completing procedures for receipt of collateral (if any).

5. With regard to the special loans specified in Point a Clause 2, Point a Clause 3, Point a Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular, the conclusion of special loan agreement, receipt of collateral (if any), and disbursement of the special loan shall comply with internal regulations of Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or the lending credit institution and special agreements made with the borrower.

Chapter III

IMPLEMENTATION

Article 23. Borrower’s responsibilities

1. Provide documents concerning the special loan to the lender in an adequate, timely and accurate manner; assume legal responsibility for the accuracy and legitimacy of provided documents.

2. Assume responsibility for the collateral for special loan which must satisfy the eligibility requirements laid down in Article 13 of this Circular or be conformable with contents about the collateral included in the Prime Minister’s decision or the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan (if any), or rights to claim debts used as collateral for the special loan which must comply with regulations of law on lending.

3. Use the granted special loan for stated purposes and repay debts in accordance with regulations herein, the Prime Minister’s decision or approved restructuring plan or transfer plan and the signed special loan agreement.

4. During the special loan term, the borrower shall:

a) Separately keep and retain documents relating to loans on which rights to claim debts are used as the collateral for special loan;

b) Not use the rights to claim debts which are used as the collateral for special loan for other purposes;

c) Monitor and evaluate the satisfaction of eligibility requirements by the collateral for special loan; add or replace the collateral according to regulations herein;

d) Submit reports on the collateral which does not meet eligibility requirements laid down in Clause 3 Article 12 of this Circular to the special control board;

dd) Submit reports to the special control board on total amounts of money collected from exercising the rights to claim debts used as collateral for the special loan within 03 working days from the day of money collection.

5. Dispose of collateral for repaying special loan debts to the lender.

6. On a monthly basis, within the first 05 days of the month following the reporting month or where necessary, submit physical reports on use of the special loan, either directly or by post, to:

a) SBV’s provincial branch (if the special loan is granted by SBV);

b) Deposit Insurance of Vietnam (if the special loan is granted by Deposit Insurance of Vietnam);

c) Cooperative Bank of Vietnam (if the special loan is granted by Cooperative Bank of Vietnam);

d) The lending credit institution (if the special loan is granted by another credit institution).

7. Submit reports to the special control board on debt repayment within 02 working days from the repayment date.

8. Perform other responsibilities as prescribed in this Circular, relevant laws and the loan agreement.

Article 24. Responsibilities of Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam and lending credit institutions

1. Consider issuing decisions on grant of special loans or extension of special loan to credit institutions in accordance with this Circular; submit reports to SBV’s Governor (via SBV Banking Supervision Agency) on approval or refusal of applications for special loans or extension of special loan.

2. Issue internal regulations on grant of special loans to credit institution placed under special control, which include contents about consideration and issuance of decisions on grant of special loan, extension of special loan, disbursement, debt collection, collateral and disposition of collateral.

3. Supervise the use of special loan by borrowers; expedite and request borrowers to repay special loan debts in accordance with regulations herein, the Prime Minister’s decision, the approved restructuring plans or transfer plans, and the signed special loan agreements.

4. Receive and dispose of collateral in accordance with regulations herein and regulations of law on secured transactions.

5. Within the first 07 working days of the month following the month in which outstanding debts occur or changes in the special loan occur at Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam or the lending credit institution, prepare a report thereof according to Appendix VI enclosed herewith and send it to SBV.

6. Comply with other regulations herein and relevant laws.

Article 25. Responsibilities of special control board

1. Supervise the use of special loan by borrowers; if the special loan is not used for the stated purposes, the special loan board shall give a written notice to the borrower.

2. Supervise revenues of the borrower (including proceeds from the collateral for the special loan) for recovering special loan debts; expedite and request the borrower to dispose of the collateral and repay the special loan debts according to this Circular.

3. Make proposals to the SBV’s Governor on debt collection and measures for collection of special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 1, Points b, c Clause 2, Points b, c Clause 3, Point b Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular.

4. Based on the borrower’s report as prescribed in Point d Clause 4 Article 23 of this Circular, expedite the borrower’s review, addition and replacement of the collateral as prescribed in this Circular.

5. Give written notification to SBV’s unit recording the special loan (SBV’s provincial branch or SBV’s Operations Center), Cooperative Bank of Vietnam, or Deposit Insurance of Vietnam of the borrower’s failure to repay the special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 3 Article 15 of this Circular.

6. Promptly submit reports to the SBV’s Governor on any issues concerning the special loan and recommended solutions.

7. Perform other responsibilities as prescribed in this Circular and relevant laws.

Article 26. Responsibilities of SBV’s affiliated units

1. The Financial Policy Department shall:

a) Act as the contact point in requesting the SBV's Governor to consider and make decisions on grant of special loans or extension of special loans in accordance with this Circular;

b) Consolidate data on the granted special loans in the cases specified in Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 of this Circular in monthly reports submitted to SBV’s Governor;

c) Act as the contact point in requesting the SBV’s Governor to respond to issues concerning the provisions of this Circular.

2. SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall:

a) Give opinions about grant of special loans or extension of special loans as prescribed herein;

b) Act as the contact point in requesting the SBV’s Governor to make decisions or request competent authorities to make decisions on proposals of special control boards as prescribed in Clause 3 Article 25 of this Circular;

c) Supervise, inspect and, within its competence, take actions against violations committed by credit institutions that are subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV Banking Supervision Agency during the implementation of regulations herein;

d) If a credit institution is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV Banking Supervision Agency as prescribed in Clause 4 Article 15 of this Circular as notified by a competent authority or detected through inspection, SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall give a written notification of violation to the borrower, SBV’s provincial branch, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam, the special control board and Financial Policy Department; such notification must indicate details about the credit institution’s failure to use the special loan for stated purposes.

3. SBV’s Operations Center shall:

a) Give its opinions about the collateral types which are financial instruments included in the credit institution’s list of collateral types as prescribed in this Circular;

b) Based on the decision to place the credit institution under special control, record the special loan which is converted from the refinancing loan at SBV’s Operations Center; notify the credit institution in writing of withdrawal of money from its account for debt recovery and implementation of the provisions in Points a, b, dd, e Clause 5, Clause 6 Article 15 of this Circular with respect to this loan;

c) With respect to the collateral of the special loan which includes financial instruments, record, pledge or blockade the collateral; terminate the pledge or blockade of collateral after receiving the written notification from SBV’s provincial bank as prescribed in Point k Clause 4 of this Article; implement the provisions in Point c Clause 5 Article 15 of this Circular;

d) Act as the contact point in implementing the provisions in Point b Clause 4 Article 12 of this Circular with respect to the special loans recorded at SBV’s Operations Center;

dd) Cooperate with SBV’s provincial branch to implement the provisions in Point d Clause 4 of this Article; give written notification to SBV’s provincial branch of recording, pledge or blockade of the collateral types which are financial instruments additionally provided by the borrower;

e) Perform other responsibilities as prescribed in this Circular.

4. Each SBV’s provincial branch shall:

a) Give opinions about grant of special loans or extension of special loans as prescribed herein;

b) Based on the decision to place the credit institution under special control, record the special loan which is converted from the refinancing loan at the SBV’s provincial branch;

c) Carry out the conclusion of special loan agreements, which must be prepared according to the Appendix V enclosed herewith, disburse loan amounts, extend loans and collect loan debts in accordance with this Circular, the SBV’s decisions on grant of special loans or extension of special loans and relevant laws;

d) Act as the contact point in implementing the provisions in Point b Clause 4 Article 12 of this Circular with respect to the special loans recorded at SBV’s provincial branch;

dd) Cooperate with SBV’s Operations Center to implement the provisions in Point d Clause 3 of this Article; give a written notification to SBV’s Operations Center of receipt of pledge of collateral which is the right to claim debts and additionally provided by the borrower (unless the special loan is recorded at SBV’s provincial branch and the borrower does not replace the collateral which includes financial instruments); give written notification to the credit institution of withdrawal of money from its account for debt recovery and implementation of the provisions in Points a, b, dd, e Clause 5, Clause 6 Article 15 of this Circular with respect to the special loans recorded at SBV’s provincial branch;

e) Cooperate with the special control board as prescribed in Clauses 1, 2 Article 25 of this Circular;

g) Within the first 07 working days of the month following the month in which outstanding debts occur or changes in the special loan occur at SBV’s provincial branch, prepare a report thereof according to Appendix VI enclosed herewith and send it to SBV Banking Supervision Agency and the Financial Policy Department;

h) Supervise, inspect and, within its competence, take actions against violations committed by credit institutions that are subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV's provincial branch during the implementation of regulations herein;

i) If a credit institution is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV’s provincial branch as prescribed in Clause 4 Article 15 of this Circular as notified by a competent authority or the special control board or detected through inspection, SBV’s provincial branch shall give a written notification of violation to the borrower, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam, the special control board, SBV Banking Supervision Agency and Financial Policy Department; such notification must indicate details about the credit institution’s failure to use the special loan for stated purposes;

k) Give a written notification to SBV’s Operations Center of full collection of principal and interest of the special loan;

l) Perform other responsibilities as prescribed in this Circular.

5. The Finance and Accounting Department shall:  provide instructions on accounting relating special loans granted to credit institutions placed under special control, including conversion of principal and interest of refinancing loans to those of special loans, and receipt of collateral for special loans.

Article 27. Transition

1. With regard to a special loan granted according to SBV’s decision and of which outstanding debts are not yet fully paid by the effective date of this Circular:

a) The special loan shall be treated according to the decision on grant of special loan or extension of special loan or the signed special loan agreement;

b) In case the restructuring plan or transfer plan or changes thereto are not yet approved, the extension of the special loan shall comply with Clauses 2, 3, 4 of this Article, Point a Clause 1, Point a Clause 2 Article 11, Article 14 of this Circular;

c) In case the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan includes contents about the extension of special loan, the extension of special loan shall conform to that approved restructuring plan or transfer plan; procedures for special loan extension shall be followed according to Article 19 of this Circular.

2. With regard to a special loan granted to the credit institution before the effective date of the Law on Credit Institutions No. 47/2010/QH12 and of which outstanding debts are not yet fully paid by the effective date of this Circular, the following procedures for grant of special loan extension shall be followed:

a) If the borrower wishes to apply for extension of the special loan before obtaining approval for its restructuring plan or for changes to its restructuring plan, at least 50 days before the debt payment due date, the borrower is required to send to the special control board 04 applications for SBV’s grant of extension of special loan, each of which must clearly indicates the name of the credit institution, number of VND account opened at the lender’s premises (if any), reasons, amounts, interest rate and period of extension, and actual operating status of the credit institution. In case the special control board is not yet established, the credit institution shall send 01 application to SBV’s provincial branch and 02 applications to SBV (the Financial Policy Department);

b) If the borrower’s application for special loan extension is approved, within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of the application specified in Point a of this Clause, the special control board shall send the application and its written opinions as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 18 of this Circular;

c) Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of the adequate application and written opinions as prescribed in Points a, b of this Clause or the application as prescribed in Point a of this Clause (in case of absence of the special control board), SBV’s provincial branch shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about contents concerning the borrower’s special loan and whether or not the extension of special loan should be granted to the borrower; If the extension of special loan should be granted, special amounts, interest rate and period of extension must be specified. If the extension of special loan should not be granted, reasons thereof must be given;

d) Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions as specified in Points a, b, c of this Clause, the Financial Policy Department shall send the application and such written opinions to the SBV Banking Supervision Agency for its opinions.

dd) Within a maximum duration of 10 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department as prescribed in Point d of this Clause, the SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the contents specified in Points a, b, c, dd Clause 5 Article 18 of this Circular;

e) If written opinions given by requested agencies are not adequate as prescribed in this Clause, within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of such written opinions, the Financial Policy Department shall send written request to relevant agencies for their additional opinions. Within a maximum duration of 10 working days from the receipt of the written request from the Financial Policy Department, requested agencies must provide their additional opinions as requested;

g) Within a maximum duration of 15 working days from the receipt of adequate opinions from relevant agencies as prescribed in Points dd, e of this Clause, the Financial Policy Department shall prepare and submit a consolidated report thereof to the SBV’s Governor for grant of extension of special loan to the borrower. If an application for special loan extension is refused, SBV shall provide written reasons for its refusal to the borrower.

3. With regard to a special loan granted to the credit institution after the effective date of the Law No. 17/2017/QH14 and of which outstanding debts are not yet fully paid by the effective date of this Circular, the following procedures for grant of special loan extension shall be followed:

a) If the borrower wishes to apply for extension of the special loan before obtaining approval for its restructuring plan or for changes to its restructuring plan, at least 50 days before the debt payment due date, the borrower is required to send to the special control board 04 applications for SBV’s grant of extension of special loan.

Such an application includes:

 (i) The application form for extension of special loan, which specifies the name of the credit institution, number of VND account opened at the lender (if any), reasons, amount, interest rate and period of extension;

 (ii) Report on the solvency of the credit institution; explanations about extended amount, term and expected interest rate of the special loan;

 (iii) Statement of funding sources in VND and use thereof which is made according to Appendix II enclosed herewith;

b) If the borrower’s application for special loan extension is approved, within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application as specified in Point a of this Clause, the special control board shall send the application and its written opinions to the special control board as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 18 of this Circular;

c) Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions specified in Points a, b of this Clause, SBV's provincial branch shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the contents specified in Points a, b, c, dd Clause 3 Article 18 of this Circular;

d) Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions as specified in Points a, b, c of this Clause, the Financial Policy Department shall send the application and such written opinions to the SBV Banking Supervision Agency for its opinions;

dd) Within a maximum duration of 10 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department, the SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the contents specified in Points b, c, e Clause 5 Article 18 of this Circular;

e) If written opinions given by requested agencies are not adequate as prescribed in this Clause, within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of such written opinions, the Financial Policy Department shall send written request to relevant agencies for their additional opinions. Within a maximum duration of 10 working days from the receipt of the written request from the Financial Policy Department, requested agencies must provide their additional opinions as requested;

g) Within a maximum duration of 15 working days from the receipt of adequate opinions from relevant agencies as prescribed in Points dd, e of this Clause, the Financial Policy Department shall prepare and submit a consolidated report thereof to the SBV’s Governor for grant of extension of special loan to the borrower. If an application for special loan extension is refused, SBV shall provide written reasons for its refusal to the borrower.

4. With regard to a special loan granted according to SBV’s decision and of which outstanding debts are not yet fully paid by the effective date of this Circular (except the special loans specified in Clauses 2, 3 of this Article), the following procedures for grant of special loan extension shall be followed:

a) If the borrower wishes to apply for extension of the special loan before obtaining approval for its restructuring plan or transfer plan or for changes to its restructuring plan, at least 50 days before the debt payment due date, the borrower is required to send to the special control board 04 applications for SBV’s grant of extension of special loan.

Such an application includes:

 (i) The application form for extension of special loan, which specifies the name of the credit institution, number of VND account opened at the lender, reasons, amount, interest rate and period of extension, and commitments to comply with regulations of law on special lending;

 (ii) Report on the solvency of the credit institution; explanations about extended amount, term and expected interest rate of the special loan;

 (iii) Statement of funding sources in VND and use thereof which is made according to Appendix II enclosed herewith;

 (iv) The list of collateral types meeting the requirements laid down in Article 13 of this Circular which is made according to Appendix VII enclosed herewith, and of which total value shall not be lower than the special loan to be extended.

b) If the borrower’s application for special loan extension is approved, within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application as specified in Point a of this Clause, the special control board shall send the application and its written opinions to the special control board as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 18 of this Circular;

c) Within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions as prescribed in Points a, b of this Clause, the Financial Policy Department shall send the application and such written opinions to the special control board to the SBV Banking Supervision Agency for its opinions. If the credit institution’s list of collateral types includes the financial instruments, the Financial Policy Department shall send the list to SBV’s Operations Center for its opinions;

d) Within a maximum duration of 10 working days from the receipt of the written request for opinions from the Financial Policy Department as prescribed in Point c of this Clause, SBV Banking Supervision Agency shall give its written opinions about the contents specified in Clause 5 Article 18 of this Circular, SBV’s Operations Center shall give its opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the collateral types which are financial instruments included in the credit institution’s list of collateral types;

dd) If written opinions given by requested agencies are not adequate as prescribed in this Clause, within a maximum duration of 05 working days from the receipt of such written opinions, the Financial Policy Department shall send written request to relevant agencies for their additional opinions. Within a maximum duration of 10 working days from the receipt of the written request from the Financial Policy Department, requested agencies must provide their additional opinions as requested;

e) Within a maximum duration of 15 working days from the receipt of adequate opinions from relevant agencies as prescribed in Points d, dd of this Clause, the Financial Policy Department shall prepare and submit a consolidated report thereof to the SBV’s Governor for grant of extension of special loan to the borrower. If an application for special loan extension is refused, SBV shall provide written reasons for its refusal to the borrower.

Article 28. Effect

1. This Circular comes into force from October 27, 2021.

2. The Circular No. 01/2018/TT-NHNN dated January 26, 2018 of SBV’s Governor and Clause 8 Article 1 of the Circular No. 14/2019/TT-NHNN dated August 30, 2019 of SBV’s Governor shall cease to have effect from the effective date of this Circular.

3. The Chief of Office, the Director of the Financial Policy Department, heads of SBV’s affiliated units, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, and credit institutions shall organize the implementation of this Circular./.

 

 

GOVERNOR




Nguyen Thi Hong

**THE STATE BANK OF VIETNAM

No.: 08/2021/TT-NHNN

_Hanoi__, July 06, 2021_

**CIRCULAR**

PRESCRIBING GRANT OF SPECIAL LOANS TO CREDIT INSTITUTIONS PLACED UNDER SPECIAL CONTROL

_Pursuant to the Law on Credits Institutions dated June 16, 2010;_

_Pursuant to the Law on amendments to the Law on credit institutions dated November 20, 2017;_

_Pursuant to the Government's Decree No. 16/2017/ND-CP dated February 17, 2017 prescribing functions, tasks, powers and organizational structure of the State bank of Vietnam;_

_At the request of the Director of the Financial Policy Department;_ 

_The Governor of the State Bank of Vietnam promulgates a Circular prescribing the grant of special loans to credit institutions placed under special control._

**Chapter I**

**GENERAL PROVISIONS**

**Article 1. Scope**

This Circular provides regulations on the grant of special loans by the State Bank of Vietnam (hereinafter referred to as “SBV”), the Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, the Cooperative Bank of Vietnam and other credit institutions to the credit institutions that are placed under special control.

**Article 2. Regulated entities**

1\. Credit institutions.

2\. Deposit Insurance of Vietnam. 

3\. Other organizations and individuals involved in the grant of special loans to the credit institutions placed under special control.

**Article 3. Definitions**

For the purposes of this Circular, the terms below are construed as follows:

1\. “restructuring plan” refers to either one of the plans specified in Clause 35 Article 4 of the Law on credit institutions (as amended).

2\. “transfer plan” means the plan specified in Clause 3 Article 3 of the Law on amendments to the Law on credit institutions (hereinafter referred to as “Law No. 17/2017/QH14”).

3\. “borrower” means a credit institution that is placed under special control and gets a special loan from SBV, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam, or another credit institution.

4\. “lender” means SBV, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam, or another credit institution that grants a special loan to a credit institution placed under special control.

5\. “preferential interest rate” means the interest rate which is lower than the refinancing rate announced by SBV in each period at the time the relevant special loan is disbursed or extended.

6\. “SBV's provincial branch" means a branch of SBV located in the province or central-affiliated city where the credit institution placed under special control is headquartered.

**Article 4. Special lending cases**

1\. SBV shall use funding sources from performance of functions of the central bank in terms of money issuance for granting special loans to credit institutions placed under special control in the following cases:

a) A special loan shall be granted for supporting the liquidity of a credit institution that is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the banking system while the credit institution is placed under special control, even if the credit institution is implementing an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan;

b) A special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% shall be granted to support the recovery of a commercial bank, cooperative bank, finance company or microfinance institution under their approved recovery plan;

c) A special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% shall be granted to support the recovery of a commercial bank under an approved mandatory transfer plan;

d) A special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% shall be granted to a commercial bank that is acquired before the effective date of the Law No. 17/2017/QH14 under the Prime Minister’s decision as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 3 of the Law No. 17/2017/QH14 (hereinafter referred to as “the Prime Minister’s decision”);

dd) A special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% shall be granted to a commercial bank that is acquired before the effective date of the Law No. 17/2017/QH14 upon the completion of transfer under the approved transfer plan.

2\. Deposit Insurance of Vietnam shall consider granting special loans to credit institutions placed under special control in the following cases:

a) A special loan shall be granted for supporting the liquidity of a credit institution that is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system while the credit institution is placed under special control, even if the credit institution is implementing an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan;

b) The loan loss provision shall be used for granting a special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% according to the SBV's decision to support the liquidity of a finance company, people's credit fund or microfinance institution that is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system before the restructuring plan is given approval;

c) The loan loss provision shall be used for granting a special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% to support the recovery of a finance company, people's credit fund or microfinance institution under an approved recovery plan.

3\. Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall consider granting special loans to credit institutions placed under special control in the following cases:

a) A special loan shall be granted for supporting the liquidity of a credit institution that is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system while the credit institution is placed under special control, even if the credit institution is implementing an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan;

b) The fund for assurance of safety of the network of people's credit funds shall be used for granting a special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% according to the SBV's decision to support the liquidity of a people's credit fund that is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system before the restructuring plan is given approval;

c) The fund for assurance of safety of the network of people's credit funds shall be used for granting a special loan with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% to support the recovery of a people's credit fund under an approved recovery plan.

4\. Other credit institutions shall consider granting special loans to credit institutions placed under special control in the following cases:

a) A special loan shall be granted for supporting the liquidity of a credit institution that is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system while the credit institution is placed under special control, even if the credit institution is implementing an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan;

b) A special loan shall be granted to support the recovery of a credit institution under an approved recovery plan or mandatory transfer plan.

**Article 5. Lending rules and settlement of special loans**

1\. With regard to the special loans specified in Points b, c, d, dd Clause 1, Point c Clause 2, Point c Clause 3, Point b Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular, the loan amount, loan purposes, collateral, lending interest rate, loan term, debt repayment, interest exemption or reduction, settlement of special loans granted (including extension of special loan, interest rate on overdue principal amount) shall comply with the Prime Minister’s decision, the approved restructuring plan or transfer plan.

2\. Special loans with a preferential interest rate as low as 0% granted by SBV shall be subject to the Prime Minister’s decision.

3\. Special loans specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4, Article 6 hereof shall be granted in accordance with regulations herein; the contents of special loans which have been decided by the Prime Minister or approved under the restructuring plan or transfer plan shall be performed according to such the Prime Minister’s decision or approved plan or transfer plan.

4\. With regard to the special loans specified in Point a Clause 2, Point a Clause 3, Point a Clause 4 Article 4 of this Circular, the loan amount, loan purposes, collateral, lending interest rate, loan term, debt repayment, interest exemption or reduction, settlement of special loans granted (including extension of special loan, interest rate on overdue principal amount) shall be performed according to specific agreements between the lender and the borrower.

5\. Currency unit used in extending special loans is Vietnamese dong (VND).

6\. Acceptance and disposition of collateral shall comply with regulations herein and regulations of law on secured transactions.

**Article 6. Conversion of refinancing loans into special loans**

1. From the day on which a credit institution is placed under special control by SBV, the refinancing loan granted to that credit institution shall be converted into a special loan as follows:

a) If the refinancing loan is not yet due, the outstanding principal and interest of the refinancing loan shall be converted into those of the special loan, and the maturity date and interest rate of the special loan shall be those of the refinancing loan;

b) In case of loan extension, the interest rate on the extended special loan shall be equal to the refinancing rate announced by SBV in each period at the time the special loan is extended;

c) If the refinancing loan is overdue, the overdue principal and delayed outstanding interests of the refinancing loan (including outstanding interests on the refinancing loan that the credit institution must pay but fails to pay on schedule) shall be converted into those of the special loan, the interest rate charged on the overdue principal of the special loan shall be that charged on the overdue principal of the refinancing loan, and the interest rate on delayed interests of the special loan shall be charged in the same manner as that charged on delayed interests of the refinancing loan.

2\. Within 15 working days from the day on which the refinancing loan is converted into the special loan, the credit institution must fully implemented the provision of Point a Clause 4 Article 12 hereof so that total conversion value of the collateral meeting the requirements set forth in Article 13 hereof (hereinafter referred to as “eligible collateral”) shall not be smaller than the outstanding principal of the refinancing loan which has been converted into the outstanding principal of the special loan as prescribed in Point a Clause 1 of this Article.

3\. The conversion of the refinancing loan into the special loan shall be specified in SBV’s decision to place the credit institution under special control.

**Article 7. Authority to sign documents included in applications for special loan, applications for extension of special loan, and special loan agreements**

Legal representative of the borrower shall have the authority to sign the documents included in the application for special loan, application for extension of special loan, and special loan agreement.

**Chapter II**

**SPECIFIC PROVISIONS**

**Article 8. Purposes of special loans**  

1\. The borrower shall only use the special loans as prescribed in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 herein to make payments to individuals who have made deposits to it. The use of a special loan to make payments to other depositors shall be decided by the SBV's Governor in each specific case.

2\. The payments specified in Clause 1 of this Article shall not be made to:

a) Related persons of the credit institution as defined in Clause 28 Article 4 of the Law on credit institutions (as amended) and relevant laws;

b) Executives of the credit institution;

c) Related persons of a manager, executive, capital-contributing member or shareholder holding at least 5% of charter capital or voting shares of the credit institution as prescribed in Clause 28 Article 4 of the Law on credit institutions (as amended) and relevant laws.

**Article 9. Special loan amount**

The amounts of the special loans specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 hereof shall be decided by SBV by taking into account the solvency of the credit institution placed under special control.

**Article 10. Special loan term**

The term of a special loan prescribed in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, or Point b Clause 3 Article 4 hereof shall be considered and decided by SBV, but less than 12 years.

**Article 11. Interest rate**

1\. With regard to the special loan specified in Point a Clause 1 Article 4 hereof:

a) The lending interest rate and the interest rate charged on an extended special loan shall be equal to the refinancing rate announced by SBV in each period at the time the relevant special loan is disbursed or extended;

b) The interest rate charged on the overdue principal of a special loan shall be 130% of the interest rate charged on due repayment determined on the day in which the debt becomes delinquent;

c) No interest will be charged on late payment of outstanding interests.

2\. With regard to the special loan specified in Point b Clause 2 or Point b Clause 3 Article 4 hereof:

a) The lending interest rate and the interest rate on the extended special loan shall be the preferential interest rate as low as 0% according to SBV's decision;

b) The interest rate charged on the overdue principal of a special loan shall be 130% of the interest rate charged on due repayment determined in the day in which the debt becomes delinquent;

c) No interest will be charged on late payment of outstanding interests.

**Article 12. Collateral for special loans granted according SBV’s decision**

1\. With regard to the special loans specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4, Point a Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular, the borrower must provide collateral in the following order of priority:

a) Pledge: Bills of State Bank, government bonds (including: treasury bills, treasury bonds, bonds for central-level works, national development bonds, government bonds issued by Vietnam Development Bank (formerly, Development Assistance Fund) according to the Prime Minister’s directive), government-guaranteed bonds of which principal and interest shall be fully paid when they are due, municipal bonds which are included in the list of financial instruments used in SBV’s transactions;

b) Pledge of bonds issued by commercial banks over 50% of charter capital of which is held by the State (except commercial banks which have been compulsorily acquired);

c) Pledge of bonds issued by credit institutions which are not placed under special control (except commercial banks specified in Point b of this Clause) and other enterprises;

d) Mortgage of rights to claim debts of loans granted by the borrower to its clients (except credit institutions).

2\. Value of collateral:

a) The value of the types of collateral specified in Clause 1 of this Article shall be determined according to the provisions of Appendix No. IV enclosed herewith;

b) Conversion value of each type of collateral for a special loan shall be determined adopting the following formula:

![](//files.thuvienphapluat.vn/doc2htm/00487648_files/image001.gif)

Where:

TS: Conversion value of a type of collateral;

GT: The value of the type of collateral which is determined according to the provisions of Appendix No. IV enclosed herewith;

TL: Collateral conversion ratio corresponding to the type of collateral.

c) The collateral conversion ratio (TL) is determined as follows:

 (i) With regard to the financial instruments specified in Point a Clause 1 of this Article, TL is the minimum ratio of the value of the financial instrument to the loan amount secured by the pledge of that financial instrument granted by SBV to the credit institution according to SBV’s regulations in each period;

 (ii) With regard to the types of collateral specified in Points b, c, d Clause 1 of this Article, TL shall be 170%.

d) At the time of application for a special loan or extension of a special loan, the credit institution must ensure that total conversion value of types of eligible collateral shall not be smaller than the amount of the special loan or extended special loan that it applies for.

3\. If any type of collateral specified in Points c, d Clause 1 of this Article does not meet the requirements laid down in Clauses 2, 3 Article 13 of this Circular resulting in that total conversion value of eligible collateral is smaller than the outstanding principal of the special loan, the borrower shall be required to implement the provisions of Point a Clause 4, Point a Clause 5 of this Article so that total conversion value of eligible collateral shall not be smaller than the outstanding principal of the special loan within 10 working days from the day in which the event that total conversion value of eligible collateral shall not be smaller than the outstanding principal of the special occurs.

4\. With regard to the special loans specified in Point a Clause 1 Article 4, Point a Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular, the addition or replacement of collateral specified in Clause 2 Article 6, Clause 3 of this Article shall be performed as follows:

a) The borrower shall prepare a written request for addition or replacement of collateral (as approved by the special control board), in which the types of collateral to be additionally provided or to be replaced must be specified, and send it to the unit recording the special loan (SBV's provincial branch or SBV Operations Center);

b) Based on the borrower’s written request specified in Point a of this Clause, the unit recording the special loan shall directly perform or cooperate with relevant units to perform procedures for addition or replacement of collateral. In case of replacement of collateral, the ineligible collateral shall be withdrawn only after the eligible collateral is provided.

5\. With regard to the special loans specified in Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 of this Circular, the addition or replacement of collateral specified in Clause 3 of this Article shall be performed as follows:

a) The borrower shall send a written request for addition or replacement of collateral (as approved by the special control board), in which the types of collateral to be additionally provided or to be replaced must be specified, to the lender;

b) Based on the borrower’s written request specified in Point a of this Clause, the lender shall perform the addition or replacement of collateral. In case of replacement of collateral, the ineligible collateral shall be withdrawn only after the eligible collateral is provided. The lender shall give written notification of the addition or replacement of collateral to the special control board, SBV (SBV Banking Supervision Agency, SBV’s provincial branch and Financial Policy Department).

**Article 13. Eligibility requirements for collateral**

1\. The financial instruments specified in Points a, b Clause 1 Article 12 of this Circular must meet the following requirements:

a) They are issued in VND;

b) They are deposited at SBV, either deposited directly at SBV or deposited on SBV’s client accounts opened at Vietnam Securities Depository and Clearing Corporation (VSDC);

c) They are not the financial instruments issued by the borrower;

d) The term to maturity of the financial instrument must be longer than the term of the special loan.

2\. The bonds specified in Point c Clause 1 Article 12 of this Circular must meet the following requirements: a) They must meet the requirements stated in Clause 1 of this Article;

b) They are listed in accordance with regulations of law;

c) The collateral is available and its value, as determined according to internal regulations of the credit institution at the nearest time to the time of application for special loan or application for extension of special loan or at the time of conversion of the refinancing loan into the special loan or at the time of valuation of collateral according to internal regulations of the credit institution during the special loan term, is not lower than the face value of bonds.

3\. The loan specified in Point d Clause 1 Article 12 of this Circular must meet the following requirements:

a) The loan is granted in VND;

b) The loan debt is classified in group 1 (standard loans) according to SBV’s regulations on classification of credits of credit institutions, excluding loans which are rescheduled according to SBV’s regulations;

c) The collateral has been provided for the entire loan amount as prescribed by law, and its value, as determined according to internal regulations of the credit institution at the nearest time to the time of application for special loan or application for extension of special loan or at the time of conversion of the refinancing loan into the special loan or at the time of valuation of collateral according to internal regulations of the credit institution during the special loan term, is not lower than the outstanding debt of the loan.

**Article 14. Extension of special loan**

In case a credit institution applies for extension of a special loan specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4, or Point a Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular before obtaining approval for its restructuring plan or transfer plan or for changes to its restructuring plan or transfer plan, the following provisions shall be followed:

1\. SBV shall consider granting extension of the special loan based on the solvency of the credit institution or policies for restructuring of the credit institution according to the Law No. 17/2017/QH14 (hereinafter referred to as “restructuring policies”) which have been submitted by SBV to the Government or Prime Minister or the restructuring policies decided by the Government, the Prime Minister or SBV, or the restructuring plan or transfer plan which has been submitted by SBV to the Government or Prime Minister.

2\. Each extension shall not exceed 12 months.

**Article 15. Repayment of special loan debts**

1\. When the special loan becomes due, the borrower shall fully repay both principal and interest on the special loan to the lender.

2\. The borrower may also repay the special loan debts before its maturity date.

3\. With regard to the special loans specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4, Article 6 of this Circular, the borrower shall repay debts in the following cases:  

a) In case the borrower earns money from exercising the rights to claim debts which are provided as collateral for the special loan (hereinafter referred to as “collected debts”), within the first 05 working days of the month, the borrower shall use total collected debts in the previous month to repay the principal amount of the special loan in the chronological order of the signed indebtedness contracts;

b) In case the borrower fails to additionally provide or replace the collateral as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 6, Clause 3 Article 12 of this Circular, within 03 working days after the deadline for addition or replacement of collateral specified in Clause 2 Article 6, Clause 3 Article 12 of this Circular, the borrower shall make repayment of the principal amount of the special loan which is at least equal to the difference between the outstanding debts of the special loan and total conversion value of types of eligible collateral;

c) With regard to the special loan specified in Article 6 of this Circular, in addition to the repayment of debts as prescribed in Points a, b of this Clause, the credit institution shall also make repayments under the signed refinancing loan agreement.

4\. With regard to the special loans specified in Point a Clause 1, Point b Clause 2, Point b Clause 3 Article 4 of this Circular, if the special loan amount is not used for the loan purposes, within 07 working days from the day on which SBV gives a written notice of violation as prescribed in Point d Clause 2, Point i Clause 4 Article 26 of this Circular (hereinafter referred to as “SBV gives a written notice of violation”), the borrower shall make repayment of loan debts to the lender as follows:

a) Total principal and interest amounts of the special loan;

b) The interest on the principal amount which has been improperly used shall be calculated at the interest rate equal to 130% of the refinancing rate announced by SBV in each period at the day on which SBV gives a written notice of violation for the period starting from the date on which the borrower receives the disbursement of the principal amount which has been improperly used and ending on the day on which SBV gives a written notice of violation.

5\. In case of the special loans specified in Point a Clause 1 Article 4, Point a Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular where the borrower fails to repay debts as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article and is not granted extension or fails to repay debts as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article and has the special loan debts as prescribed in Point c Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular, SBV shall take the following measures:

a) Mark and manage the outstanding debt of the special loan as an overdue debt, and charge interest at the interest rate specified in Point b Clause 1 Article 11 of this Circular on the principal amount of the special loan which is not repaid on schedule in accordance with SBV’s regulations on methods for calculation and accounting of revenues and payment of interests in depositing and lending operations between SBV and credit institutions (except the special loan debts specified in Point c Clause 1 Article 6 of this Circular);

b) Take out money from the borrower’s account opened at SBV for recovering the special loan debts (including principal and interest) after giving a written notice of such action to the credit institution;

c) Request the borrower to transfer the ownership of collateral which is the financial instruments specified in Point a Clause 1 Article 12 of this Circular to SBV;

d) Take measures for disposition of the collateral specified in Points a, b, c Clause 1 Article 12 of this Circular for recovering the special loan debts (including principal and interest);

dd) Collect the special loan debts (including principal and interest) from the borrower’s proceeds from disposition of the collateral specified in Points b, c, d Clause 1 Article 12 of this Circular;

e) Collect the special loan debts (including principal and interest) from the borrower’s other funding sources (if any).

6\. In case the borrower fails to repay the special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article, SBV shall take the following measures:

a) Apply the interest rate equal to 130% of the interest rate on the special loan on the outstanding principal amount of the special loan as prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article (hereinafter referred to as “outstanding principal”) for the period starting from the date following the deadline for debt repayment specified in Clause 3 of this Article and ending on the day on which the borrower fully repays the outstanding principal; 

b) Take out money from the borrower’s account opened at SBV for recovering debts (including outstanding principal and interest as prescribed in Point a of this Clause) within 05 working days from the receipt of the written notice from the special control board as prescribed in Clause 5 Article 25 of this Circular;

c) Collect the special loan debts (including principal and interest) from the borrower’s other funding sources (if any).

7\. In case the borrower fails to repay the special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article and is not granted extension or fails to repay the special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam or Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall take the following measures:

a) Mark and manage the loan principal and interest which are not yet paid by the borrower when they become due as overdue debts, and charge interest at the interest rate prescribed in Point b Clause 2 Article 11 of this Circular on the overdue principal amount;

b) With regard to the special loan specified in Point b Clause 3 Article 4 of this Circular, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall take out money from the borrower’s account opened at Cooperative Bank of Vietnam (if any) for recovering the special loan debts (including principal and interest);

c) Take measures for disposition of collateral as prescribed by law for recovering the special loan debts (including principal and interest);

d) Collect the special loan debts (including principal and interest) from the borrower’s other funding sources (if any).

8\. In case the borrower fails to repay the special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article, Cooperative Bank of Vietnam shall take the following measures:

a) Apply the interest rate equal to 130% of the interest rate on the special loan on the outstanding principal for the period starting from the date following the deadline for debt repayment specified in Clause 3 of this Article and ending on the day on which the borrower fully repays the outstanding principal; 

b) Take out money from the borrower’s account opened at Cooperative Bank of Vietnam (if any) for recovering debts (including outstanding principal and interest as prescribed in Point a of this Clause) within 05 working days from the receipt of the written notice from the special control board as prescribed in Clause 5 Article 25 of this Circular;

c) Collect the special loan debts (including principal and interest) from the borrower’s other funding sources (if any).

9\. In case the borrower fails to repay the special loan debts as prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article, Deposit Insurance of Vietnam shall take the following measures:

a) Apply the interest rate equal to 130% of the interest rate on the special loan on the outstanding principal for the period starting from the date following the deadline for debt repayment specified in Clause 3 of this Article and ending on the day on which the borrower fully repays the outstanding principal; 

b) Collect the special loan debts (including principal and interest) from the borrower’s other funding sources (if any).

10\. The special loan must be repaid before every other debts of the credit institution, including those secured by collateral, in the following cases:

a) The loan debts become due, unless the restructuring plan or transfer plan of the credit institution is not yet approved or changes to its restructuring plan or transfer plan are not yet approved;

b) The credit institution is dissolved or goes bankrupt.

11\. If the borrower is not financially capable of paying debts to all lenders and the special loans fall in the case specified in Clause 10 of this Article, payments shall be made to all lenders in proportion to the outstanding debts.

**Article 16. SBV’s consideration and grant of special loans for supporting liquidity** 

1\. When the credit institution placed under special control is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and wishes to apply for a special loan, it shall send 04 sets of application for a special loan granted by SBV to the special control board.

An application for special loan includes:

a) An application form for special loan, which specifies the name of the credit institution, number of VND account opened at SBV's provincial branch (if any), reasons and amount of the special loan (which shall not exceed total conversion value of types of collateral included in the list specified in Point dd of this Clause), special loan purposes, term and proposed interest rate, commitments to use the loan amount for stated purposes and comply with regulations of law on special lending, and whether or not the credit institution has an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan;

b) Report on insolvency risk or status, measures taken and to be taken, and explanations about amount, term and interest rate of the expected special loan;

c) Statement of deposit balances in VND which is made according to Appendix I enclosed herewith;

d) Statement of funding sources in VND and use thereof which is made according to Appendix II enclosed herewith;

dd) List of collateral types made according to Appendix III enclosed herewith. In case the Prime Minister’s decision, or the approved recovery plan, mandatory transfer plan or transfer plan includes contents about the collateral for the special loan for supporting liquidity, the list of collateral types must be conformable with such contents.

2\. If the credit institution’s application for special loan is approved, within 03 working days from the receipt of the adequate application as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the special control board shall send 01 set of application to SBV’s provincial branch (if the applicant is subject to the microprudential supervision of SBV’s provincial branch), and 02 other sets of application to SBV (the Financial Policy Department), accompanied by its opinions about the following contents:

a) The operating status and solvency of the credit institution;

b) Specific opinions about the fact the credit institution is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and such insolvency threatens the stability of the system;

c) Whether or not the credit institution has an approved restructuring plan or transfer plan; contents of the special loan for supporting liquidity specified in the Prime Minister’s decision or approved restructuring plan or transfer plan as prescribed in Clause 3 Article 5 of this Circular (if any);

d) Proposal for grant of special loan to the credit institution, which indicates specific amount, purpose, term and interest rate of the special loan.

3\. Within a maximum duration of 02 working days from the receipt of an adequate application and written opinions specified in Clauses 1, 2 of this Article, SBV's provincial branch shall give its written opinions to the Financial Policy Department about the following contents:

a) The operating status and solvency of the credit institution;

b) Specific opinions about whether or not the credit institution is in danger of becoming insolvent or has become insolvent and whether or not such insolvency threatens the stability of the system;

c) Whether or not the credit institution has an approved restructuring plan (if the credit institution’s restructuring plan is subject to the decision of SBV’s provincial branch); contents about the special loan for supporting liquidity included in the approved restructuring plan (if any);

d) Based on the list of collateral types specified in Point dd Clause 1 of this Article, opinions about the satisfaction of eligibility requirements laid down in Article 13 of this Circular by the listed collateral types. In case the credit institution’s restructuring plan approved by SBV’s provincial branch includes contents about the collateral for the special loan granted for supporting liquidity, opinions about the conformity of the list of collateral types with such contents shall be given;
